Package uk.ac.ljmu.fet.cs.csw.CompetitiveMinesweeper.competition

Class SingleMatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ljmu.fet.cs.csw.CompetitiveMinesweeper.competition.SingleMatch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Scorer
    public class SingleMatch
extends Object
implements Scorer
    Allows the arrangement of a single match between two solvers. To minimise the effect of luck, a single match is played on the same initially randomly generated map 5 times. The score of the solvers is determined based on their performance in all 5 attempts at the map.
    Author:
    "Gabor Kecskemeti, Department of Computer Science, Liverpool John Moores University, (c) 2019"

    • Method Detail

      • runMatch

        public void runMatch()
              throws InstantiationException,
                     IllegalAccessException,
                     IllegalArgumentException,
                     InvocationTargetException,
                     NoSuchMethodException,
                     SecurityException,
                     InterruptedException
        Runs two solvers in parallel (the solvers are started in a random order to make sure the timing of their performance is consistent) and tests them for their performance on a randomly generated map. The map's complexity is also set randomly within the limits of this class' constants. The mine ratio of the map is set between Easy to Insane (see MineSweeper.levels). A single map is generated, but each solver has a chance to solve it 5 times. The final score of the match is determined based on the total points awarded by getCurrentScore(MineMap, long, MineMap, long) after each chance.
        Throws:
        InstantiationException - if there is an issue of instantiation with one of the solvers
        IllegalAccessException - if there is an issue of instantiation with one of the solvers
        IllegalArgumentException - if there is an issue of instantiation with one of the solvers
        InvocationTargetException - if there is an issue of instantiation with one of the solvers
        NoSuchMethodException - if there is an issue of instantiation with one of the solvers
        SecurityException - if there is an issue of instantiation with one of the solvers
        InterruptedException - if the sleep of the runMatch method was interrupted externally. If an interruption occurs, the match never reaches its completion
        RuntimeException - if one tries to re-run an already done match.

      • getCurrentScore

        private static int getCurrentScore​(MineMap teamOne,
                                   long durOne,
                                   MineMap teamTwo,
                                   long durTwo)
        Calculates the score of the team which was listed first in its parameters. The calculation is following the below scheme:
        1. Awards 100 points if the first team won but the other lost the game
        2. Awards 90 points if both teams won but the first one was faster
        3. Awards 80 points if both teams won but the first one was slower
        4. Awards 0 points if the first team lost but the second won
        5. If both teams lost the map, they both receive points based on two components:
          • the ratio of correctly/incorrectly flagged mines (incorrect ones are strongly penalised), max 20 points
          • the ratio of the explored areas of the two teams (i.e., how much more the first team explored), max 40 points - 20 is the baseline if both teams explore around the same area.
        Parameters:
        teamOne - The final map of the first team
        durOne - The time it took team one to solve the map
        teamTwo - The final map of the second team
        durTwo - The time it took for the second team to solve the map
        Returns:
        The score of the team which was listed first in the parameters

      • getPointsForTeamOne

        public int getPointsForTeamOne()
        Tells how the first team performed in the match. If the match has not been run just yet, this returns -1. See the getCurrentScore(MineMap, long, MineMap, long) method for details on how a solver's score is determined.
        Specified by:
        getPointsForTeamOne in interface Scorer
        Returns:
        an integer score (the bigger the score is better). Note the particular range of values are to be determined by the particular implementation.

      • getPointsForTeamTwo

        public int getPointsForTeamTwo()
        Tells how the second team performed in the match. If the match has not been run just yet, this returns -1. See the getCurrentScore(MineMap, long, MineMap, long) method for details on how a solver's score is determined.
        Specified by:
        getPointsForTeamTwo in interface Scorer
        Returns:
        an integer score (the bigger the score is better). Note the particular range of values are to be determined by the particular implementation.

      • isMatchRan

        public boolean isMatchRan()
        Allows to query whether the match has already been done or not.
        Returns:
        true if the match was done and the points for the scorer are the correct ones
